revised_title: Investigating the Functions and Nature of Animal Powers
tldr: The author investigates the powers of life in more perfect animals, focusing on the contractile power of the muscular fiber and the functions of the nervous system. They conclude that the power of the muscular fiber resides within the fiber itself, and that the nervous system has distinct sets of organs with different functions. The author also explores the role of ganglionic nerves in supplying muscles of involuntary motion and vital organs.
